supportDesc.condition: The boards and the original sewing are missing. Some of the leaves are sewn together with stitch repairs (e.g. fols. 56-63). All fols. are very worn. Many fols. are misplaced, many are missing. Many fols. are damaged by water (e.g. fols. 28-30, 84-88). Some fols. are torn with loss of text (e.g. fols. 3-4). Tear carefully amended on fol. 102.

list.item:
f. 1r-v: Gadla sämaʿtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment (incipit page of the Vita of Hernewos).
The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005.

f. 19r-v: Gadla sämaʿtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment.
The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005. It contains the colophon mentioning 6955 year of mercy (= 1463 A.D.) as the date of completion of the writing, and ʾabuna Ṗeṭros as the commissioner. The colophon is preceded by an extensive (historiographic?) note (fol. 19r) mentioning Metropolitan Gäbrǝʾel (who arrived in Ethiopia in 1438 and died possibly in 1458, s. EAE II, 632).

f. 106r-v: Gadla sämaʿtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment.
The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005.
- Unclear note (possibly a directive for the minister): fol. 35v.

binding.decoNote: Both wooden boards and the threads of the binding are missing. Two pairs of sewing stations.

decoDesc.decoNote: Nomina sacra; incipit of Text I and its sections; numbers, titles and incipits of the canons; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals.
